unit.doc: The Assemblage Library.Assemblage provides a simple embedded domain specific language to describe OCaml Assemblageprojectsprojects. It also provides simple tools to configure, manage, install and use OCaml projects.Describing a project eventually leads to describe its build artifacts. The exact mapping betweem project elements and those build artifacts depends on the presence or absence of AssemblageFeaturesfeatures. Examples of such features are weather to compile and run the tests (user-defined feature), the presence of the native compiler (system-dependant feature), compiling a library using async or lwt as a backend (environment-dependant feature), ...Finally, generating build artifacts means refining the project description into concrete AssemblageFlagscommand line arguments to pass to the different compilers (ocamlc, ocamlopt) on the different compilation and linking phases.Release %%VERSION%% - %%AUTHOR%%

module.doc: Features.Features declare booleans to be determined by the Assemblagebuildenvbuild environment. They allow to condition the application of certain AssemblageFlagsflags and restrict the build of project components or of certain of their artifacts.Examples of features are: native compilation availability, optional package availability, debug build support, etc.

type.doc: The type for features. Given a build environment a value of this type denotes a boolean value.

value.doc: create default name doc is a feature named name. default (defaults to true) indicates the boolean value the feature takes if the build environment doesn't determine it. doc is used for documenting the feature in various contexts, keep it short and to the point.
true_ is always true.
false_ is always false.
neg f is true iff f is false. If on is specified, negates if on is true and true_ is returned if on is false.

signature.comment: not_ f is true iff f is false.

value.doc: f &&& f' is true iff both f and f' are true.
f ||| f' is true iff either f or f' is true.
byte is true iff byte code compilation is available.
native is true iff native code compilation is available.
native_dynlink is true iff native code dynamic linking is available.
native_toolchain is true iff the native compiled OCaml toolchain is available (.opt tools).
js is true iff JavaScript compilation is available.
annot is true iff binary annotations files must be built.
debug is true iff builds must support debugging.
warn_error is true iff builds must consider warnings as errors.
test is true iff tests must be built.
public_doc is true iff the documentation must be built.

module.doc: FlagsFlags values denote sets of partial command line arguments given to tools in a given context. A context is defined by a compilation phasephase.FIXME describe valid context and to what they correspond.

type.doc: The type for compilation phases.
The type for partial command line arguments.
The type for multi-context, partial, command line arguments.

value.doc: v available phase mode args is the partial command line args in the context defined by phase and modes. This partial command line is only available whenever the feature available is true (defaults to AssemblageFeaturestrue_).
f @@@ f' concatenates context wise f' to f. f' and f' remain available according to their own available argument.
empty is the command line [] for every context.
debug is the debug flag as needed per context, only available when AssemblageFeaturesdebug is true.
annot is the -bin-annot flag in appropriate contexts, only available when AssemblageFeaturesannot is true.
warn_error is the -warn-error in appropriate contexts, only available when AssemblageFeatureswarn_error is true.
linkall is the -linkall flag in appropriate contexts.
thread is the -thread flag in appropriate contexts.
vmthread is the -vmthread flag in appropriate contexts.
The -cclib x flags.
The -ccopt x flags.
stub s adds -cclib -ls -dllib -ls to the bytecode linking options and -cclib -ls to the native linking options.

unit.comment: A project defines different kinds of names: local and external library names. A local library name needs to be associated with the name of the local directory where the build artifacts for that library are created and an external library name needs to be associated with the global directory where the object files for that library are installed.

type.doc: The type for internal and external name resolvers.

value.doc: build_dir t is the directory where lives all the build artifacts.
Resolve global package names into command line flags.

type.doc: Custom actions.
The different kinds of files.

value.doc: bash ~dir fmt is a generator which produces some results by calling fmt in a bash shell, running in the directory dir.

type.doc: Type of action generators.
The type of nodes in the action graph.
An action rule is a list of target nodes, prerequesite nodes and an action.

value.doc: Create a new rule.
The generator of empty actions.

unit.comment: AssemblagecompsComponentsA project is a set of components. Each component describes a logical build unit like a compilation unit, a library, a binary, a test, the documentation of a library, etc. A component can depend on other components, either because it needs the dependencies to be part of it or because it needs them to be build.

type.doc: The type for compilation unit descriptions.
The type for arbitrarily constructed files descriptions.
The type for package descriptions.
The type for library descriptions.
The type for binary executable descriptions.
The type for containers of components.
The type for test descriptions.
The type for documentation descriptions.

The type for components.
`Unit u u is a project compilation unit.
`Lib l is a project library.
`Bin b is a project binary.
`Test b is a project test.
`Pkg p is an external named package.
FIXME

value.doc: unit name dir ~available ~flags ~deps is a compilation unit named name (the filename without extension) present in directory dir. It is only available whenever available is true, it must be build with flags and depends on deps to be built.TODO document opaque & hidden.
Pack compilation units together.
Same as Assemblageunit but for C source files.
Same as Assemblageunit but for javascript source files.
Generated source file(s).
lib name units is the project library name composed by the compilation units cus. If lib is set, use ocamldep to approximate the compilation units and their dependecies in the given directory.
lib_pp is like Assemblagelib but it defines a project pre-processor.

bin name units is the binary name obtained by compiling the compilation units units, with the dependencies deps. By default, the source files are located into bin/ (this is controled by the value of dir).
FIXME: doc

pkg available opt name is an external OCaml package named name. It is only available whenever available is true. If opt is true (defaults to false) a feature f is automatically created for the package and anded to available.
pkg_pp available opt name is like Assemblagepkg except it denotes an external OCaml pre-processor package.
pkg_c available opt name is like Assemblagepkg except it denotes an external C package.

type.doc: The type for test commands.
The type for command line arguments when calling tests of executable.

value.doc: A test which runs a binary built in the project.
A test which runs an arbitrary shell command.
Description of a test.
Description of documentation files.
unit_in c name is the unit named name is the component c. Raise Not_found if not unit has this name.
build_dir t r is the directory where the component t is built.
root_dir r is the root directory of the project.
stubs name dir is the C stub generations, using Ctypes, of the compilation unit name. The Name_bindings module should be located in dir.

type.doc: The type for OCaml projects descriptions. Simply a set of components.

value.doc: project name comps TODO

signature.comment: Build environment.The build environment (which can be an human) discovers available features.

type.doc: Environment values.

value.doc: Default project configuration.
assemble project runs the default assemblage command line tool with the assemble file file (defaults to assemble.ml.
Same as Filename.concat.
